question: The media should stop reporting details of crimes to the public because it only has negative influences on them. To what extent do you agree or disagree ?
text: Some people think that television should stop reporting lawlessness to the public because it has negative on audiences. I hold that it would be arbitrary to take a superficial view and conclude that the news should become to a halt.

It believes that the coverage reporting minutiae of scandal to the public may hurt the mass. However, reporting the misdeeds to the public also has positive aspects. That antisocial behavior details to the public are conducive to raising the public's alertness and safety awareness, thus reducing the possibility of being killed. For example, last year, Since a girl was killed by a ride on a ride-hailing program booked by a taxi-hailing.
Many taxi-hailing operating companies pay attention to select the driver and improved the taxi-hailing system, adding real-time positioning, recording, and dialing emergency contact numbers,
to provide the public with a safe and secure ride.

At the same time, after learning about the report, more crowd, especially women, will try their best to reduce going out alone at night, carry alarm equipment with them, and be alert and aware of taking a taxi.

Though, reporting the crime to the public brings some drawbacks to the mass, which also provides an essential anti-scandal experience and enhances folk's ability to prevent the violation. The purpose of reporting a trivial matter of misdemeanor is to give the public the right to know the whole truth. If the media stops crimes, it will perpetuate an ignorant and dangerous environment for the citizens, with many serious consequences. First of all, the radio's behavior of not telling the public the truth of the event infringes people's right to know. Some bureaucrats to use their power to sweep that under the carpet. That makes the people blinded by the incomplete information reported by the media, and it is easy to form incorrect values. Besides, there are deeper social problems behind some criminals.  If the government does not understand and focus on these social problems, there will be more tragedies like this, and people will be in danger all the time.

To sum up, it is wrong for televisions to stop reporting wrongdoing to the public because it infringes on the public's own rights and puts the man and the whole society in unknown danger. Since the minutiae of violation play a role, both the media and the relevant government departments should be more open to the mass, and use this
essential information to prevent a similar atrocity.
